Models¶

Models used within the Gallery app. The main model class is the Gallery, which associates many mimesis.models.MediaUpload objects together into a common “container”.

class gallery.models.Gallery(*args, **kwargs)¶

A gallery that has the following:

  • A name (max length 50 chars)
  • A description (optional)
  • An owner (Foreign key to django.contrib.auth.models.User)
  • Creation date/time
  • ManyToManyField to mimesis.models.MediaUpload, through a GalleryMedia obejct
  • Cover image, a ForeignKey to mimesis.models.MediaUpload that will appear as the thumbnail for the gallery.
  • Sites, a ManyToManyField to django.contrib.sites.models.Site.
add_media(media_upload)¶

Associates a mimesis.MediaUpload object with this gallery.

add_site(site)¶

Associates a django.contrib.sites.models.Site object with this gallery.

from_zip(zip_file, initial=False)¶

Populates a gallery with photos within a zip archive.

When a zip archive comes in, it is first checked for corrupt files. If nothing’s corrupted, it’s contents are unpacked into MEDIA_ROOT, and an associated mimesis.MediaUpload model/file are created and bound to the gallery. Once that is finished, the file in MEDIA_ROOT is deleted.

If the initial argument is True, then this function will set the gallery’s cover image to the first file extracted from the archive.

Most of this function is based on Photologue’s GalleryUpload.process_zipefile method, changed to use the mimesis.MediaUpload models.

remove_media(media)¶

Removes a mimesis.models.MediaUpload instance from this gallery.

class gallery.models.GalleryAssociation(*args, **kwargs)¶

Generic relationship between a gallery and any other Django model.

Includes a description text field.

class gallery.models.GalleryMedia(*args, **kwargs)¶

A ‘pass through’ model for ManyToMany relationsips between Gallery and mimesis.models.MediaUpload objects.

class gallery.models.GallerySites(*args, **kwargs)¶

Pass through model to link Gallery objects to django.contrib.sites.models.Site.
